Class ServerCore

java.lang.Object
ocsf.server.AbstractServer
server_core.ServerCore
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ServerCore extends AbstractServer
ServerCore is the main server-side controller extending AbstractServer. It handles incoming client requests, manages threads for monitoring parking orders and generating monthly reports, and interfaces with the database via the DBhandler.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerCore

      public ServerCore(String ip, int port, Connection con)
      Constructs the ServerCore with IP, port, and a database connection.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address of the server
      port - the port number to listen on
      con - the JDBC database connection

  • Method Details

    • setAPIkeys

      public void setAPIkeys(String recoveryAPI, String ordersMonitorAPI)
      Sets the Discord API webhook URLs for recovery and orders monitor notifications.
      Parameters:
      recoveryAPI - URL for recovery notifications
      ordersMonitorAPI - URL for order-related notifications

    • start

      public boolean start()
      Starts the server and begins listening for client connections.
      Returns:
      true if the server started successfully, false otherwise

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the server and its associated monitoring threads.

    • liveAdd

      public void liveAdd(String userId, String ip)
      Adds a user to the list of live clients. The entry includes the current time, user ID, and IP address.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user
      ip - the IP address of the user

    • liveRemove

      public void liveRemove(String userId)
      Removes a user from the list of live clients. The removal is based on a partial match of the user ID in the entries.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to remove

    • getLiveClients

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getLiveClients()
      Retrieves the list of live clients.
      Returns:
      an observable list of live client entries

    • getLogList

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getLogList()
      Retrieves the connection log list.
      Returns:
      an observable list of log entries

    • exportLogToCSV

      public void exportLogToCSV()
      Exports the server connection log to a CSV file. The log entries are parsed into a structured format and saved to a user-specified file. If no log entries are available, the method exits with a warning message. The file name is pre-filled with the format "BparkConnectionLog_dd_MM_yyyy.csv", where "dd_MM_yyyy" is the current date.
      See Also:
      • for file selection dialog.
